ratings.comment: Professor Riley has very interesting lectures, but her exams aren't always on the lectures. Her exams are not multiple choice, all free response and incredibly difficult. She was disorganized with assigning readings and homework as well, piling it on at the end the semester. The reading even covers topics not discussed in lecture.

Overall I really liked Riley as a professor. The class was very interesting, but since you only meet twice a week, you have a lot of reading you have to do. You're also expected to memorize A LOT for the tests, but tests don't necessarily consist of all the material on the study guide. She's very nice though, and is always open to answer questions.

Riley is good at explaining. Lectures aren't bad, she makes them fun. Don't miss this class, it's too hard to catch up. LOTS of reading; the textbook is necessary to pass. She tests you on some things that she doesn't teach (SO READ THE BOOK). Tests? Not bad if you study. She is super nice. DON'T expect grades back anytime soon. Very slow grader.
I absolutely loved this class. She is very patient and helpful.

She is extremely smart, and the classes are interesting and thorough. The tests are graded reallly fairly but you will have to put in some effort. I felt that if you paid attention in class you would do well as well as reading the readings- but she makes them easy with worksheets. I really enjoyed the class!

Really a great teacher, I enjoyed going to her class every day, even if it was at 8 am. The tests were fiarly hard, but te extra credit at the end of the term helped. Extremely compassionate woman totally understood when i had to miss a test and offered to let me take it the next day.
When I grow up I want to be Susan Riley. She is smart and compassionate and made me want to know what she was teaching. She is the best professor I have as yet encountered at Madison.
She is acomadating and helpful, the tests are fairly hard
